bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Donald Kerracher - Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328
Exceptions.

Comes now the United States of America and Charles C. Hokpins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, respondents in the above en- titled matter, by Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and duly except to the order of disacharge made and entered in the above entitled matter on the 20th day of Sep- tember 1905, for the reasons and upon the grounds following, to wit:
I. That Court erred in finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was wrongfully restrained of his liberty,
II. The Court erred in finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Kerracher, was unlawfully held in custody by the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington.
III. The Cout erred in holding and finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Kerracher, was unlawfully held in custody by the Warden of the United States Penitent- iary on McNeil's Island, Washington.
IV. The Cout erred in holding and finding that the terms of imprisonment of the petitioner, Donald Mc Kerr- acher, had expried as provided by law.

V. The Court erred in ordering and adjusting that the petitioner, Donald Mc Kerracher, was entitled to be discharged from the cusotdy of the United States Marshal for the Western District of Wahsington.
VI. The Court erred in ordering and directing the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington to discharge said petitioner, Donald Mc Kerracher, from custody and imprisonment.
VII. The Court erred in ordering and directing that the petitoner, Donald Mc Keeracher, be discharged from the United States penitentiary on McNeil's Island, Washington.
VIII. The Court erred in ordering the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, to be released from the custody of the officers of the United States.
IX. The Court erred in releasing and discharging the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, from the custody of the officers of the United States and restoring him to his liberty.
X. The Said order of discharge is not supported by the law controlling in the premises,
XI. That said order of discharge is contrary to the facts in the premises.
XII. That said order of discharge is not warranted by, nor supported by, the facts, nor by the law in the premises, but is contrary thereto.
Dated this 20th day of September 1905.
Jesse A. Ayres, United States Attorney.
Due and timely service of the within Exceptions, and the receipt of a true copyh thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for Petitioner.
